Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Extracting title attribute and linktext of an HTML-anchor

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

Hi Christian,

The ExtractorHTML class is used to add URIs to the queue waiting to be crawled. Since the title tag is not a valid URI it doesn't help to extract that tag in a modified version of that class. You could write your own writer class to store the title, and other tags to a file or database for that URI.

You can extract the title tag using a regular expression.

"(?i)(<title>.*?</title>)"

As an example.

----- Original Message ----
From: Christian Krumm <signore.chrissi@...>
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, February 18, 2008 3:18:32 PM
Subject: [archive-crawler] Extracting title attribute and linktext of an HTML-anchor

of

linktext.
Is

of

features 
already 
implemented 
in 
Heritrix?
I 
can't 
actually 
find 
it 
in 
the 
current 
sourcecode 
of 
ExtractorHTML.

If 
I 
have 
to 
implement 
it 
on 
my 
own, 
I 
think 
it 
whould 
be 
good 
practise 
to 
write 
an 
own 
extractor,
and 
to 
use 
alist 
on 
the 
CrawlURI 
level 
to 
save 
the 
extracted 
features. 
A 
post
processor 
after 
the 
LinkScoper 
"transfers" 
these 
key-value 
pairs 
to
the 
"out 
candidate 
links". 
Or 
is 
there 
even 
a 
better 
way 
to 
implement 
it?

Any 
help 
whould 
be 
appreciated
Thanks 
a 
lot

Christian 
Krumm
